definition: to serve in the army/to be a soldier
parade guards (usually spaced out along parade routes)/example/model/pacesetter

sentences.english: MR. LU’S fascination with war came from eight years of service in the Chinese Army.
sentences.chinese: 陆川对于战争的着迷缘于他当了八年兵。

sentences.english: Native troops armed with a simple bow and a crude stone axe.
sentences.chinese: 雇佣弓箭兵装备猎弓和简陋石斧。
而这些人只是些小兵小卒。

sentences.english: When his pawn reached the other side, it was queened.
sentences.chinese: 当他的兵达到另一边时，它变成皇后。

sentences.english: And they said unto Moses, Thy servants have taken the sum of the men of war which are under our charge, and there lacketh not one man of us.
sentences.chinese: 对他说，仆人权下的兵已经计算总数，并不短少一人。

sentences.english: In the chess game, he advanced his pawn forward two spaces.
sentences.chinese: 下国际象棋时，他让兵前进了两格。

sentences.english: And the soldiers led him away into the hall, called Praetorium; and they call together the whole band.
sentences.chinese: 兵丁把耶稣带进衙门院里，叫齐了全营的兵。
调整兵得到经验值的方式。

sentences.english: Support players will deplete ammunition quickly, and will need the rifleman class to resupply them.
sentences.chinese: 支援兵的弹药消耗很快，需要突击兵来补给他们。

sentences.english: Fifthly, insist on reasonable medical treatment to ensure serving army.
sentences.chinese: 坚持合理医疗，确保姓军为兵。

sentences.english: The White pieces have no supporting points and they cannot defend their pawns on the K-side.
sentences.chinese: 白棋的子力没有支撑，他们无法保护王翼的兵。
我们曾提到过一个长矛兵。

sentences.english: That said, he totally forgot the lancer.
sentences.chinese: 说完这话，他把那长矛兵完全丢在脑后了。

sentences.english: Sean joined the Royal Navy in 1991 as a missile-man.
sentences.chinese: 1991年，肖恩加入皇家海军成为一名导弹发射兵。

sentences.english: Javelin Soldier IFVs are a very good anti-vehicle, anti-air, and anti-building unit.
sentences.chinese: 标枪兵IFV是非常好的反装甲，防空，反建筑单位。

sentences.english: The army marched into the field to fight Israel, and the battle took place in the forest of Ephraim.
sentences.chinese: 兵就出到田野迎着以色列人，在以法莲树林里交战。

definition: soldier/servant/to finish/to die/finally/at last/pawn in Chinese chess
strong soldiers/make the military powerful (political slogan)
